item.title: Second Year Courses + Tips
item.description: I receive a lot of DMs asking me to give feedback on second-year ECE courses, so here I’ve provided the class average of each course and my best piece of advice for success in the course. Fall Semester ECE231: Introductory Electronics (C+) Don’t try to memorize the circuit types and different types of problems, make sure you understand why they work the way they do. ECE241: Digital Systems (C+) Practice your Boolean Algebra, it makes up a large portion of your midterm (which again is a large portion of your grade).

item.title: Third Year
item.description: Winter courses are subject to change. Fall ECE331: Analog Electronics ECE334: Digital Electronics ECE344: Operating Systems Lecture Notes (up to midterm only) ECE552: Computer Architecture Lecture Notes (up to midterm only) ECO101: Principles of Microeconomics Winter ECE302: Probability and Applications ECE342: Computer Hardware ECE361: Computer Networks I ECE472: Engineering Economic Analysis & Entrepreneurship JRE420: People Management and Organizational Behaviour

item.title: Second Year
item.description: Fall ECE231: Introductory Electronics Textbook Notes (Chapter 3 on semiconductors missing) ECE244: Programming Fundamentals Textbook Notes MAT290: Advanced Engineering Mathematics Combined Textbook Notes MAT291: Introduction to Mathematical Physics Combined Textbook + Lecture Notes Winter ECE212: Circuit Analysis Textbook Notes (Very Rough) Formula Sheet ECE216: Signals and Systems Textbook Notes (Very Rough) ECE221: Electric & Magnetic Fields Textbook Notes (Very Rough) ECE243: Computer Organization Processor Design Lecture Notes Summer JRE410: Marketing and Competitive Strategy Lecture Notes

item.title: First Year
item.description: Fall APS110: Engineering Chemistry and Materials Science Textbook Notes + Lecture Excerpts APS111: Engineering Strategies and Practice I Lecture Notes + Textbook Excerpts MAT188: Linear Algebra Lecture Readings Notes Winter APS106: Fundamentals of Computer Programming Textbook Notes APS112: Engineering Strategies and Practice II Lecture Notes + Textbook Excerpts ECE110: Electrical Fundamentals Lecture Notes and Textbook Notes Formula Sheet MAT187: Calculus II Lecture Readings Notes MIE100: Dynamics Textbook Notes Formula Sheet

item.title: First Year Courses + Tips
item.description: I receive a lot of DMs asking me to give feedback on first-year engineering courses, so here I’ve provided the class average of each course and my best piece of advice for success in the course. Fall Semester APS100: Orientation to Engineering (H/P/F) Get to know your TA and listen when they talk about their experiences, they were once in your shoes and have valuable advice for how to make the best of your student experience, whether it comes to careers, clubs, or school-life balance.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I’m studying Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Toronto, where I enjoy working at the intersection of hardware and software, especially computer architecture and digital design. In summer 2025, I interned as an FPGA engineer at Prof. Roman Genov’s Intelligent Sensory Microsystems Lab (ISML), refining my Verilog skills and dabbling in digital design. Currently, I’m TA’ing APS100 (Orientation to Engineering), helping first-year students transition into university life. Next summer, I’ll be joining Marvell as a Digital IC Design Intern for my PEY!

item.title: Course Notes
item.description: I’ve curated a collection of my course notes on this page. If a course is missing, there are no notes available. Note: These notes are not meant to serve as a complete study guide; they are meant to provide a preview into the course content. First Year Second Year Third Year
